column4: complex question: why are all applications not simply coded and run as portable applications? why bother registering with the operating system at all?
Because applications have to do things like 'open this file' and that depends heavily on the OS.  Not all OS's are written the same.
Well from version to version things rarely change.  But from OS to OS there are big changes.
Well to make them portable they have to put in checks for which OS is running to act differently.  Those checks make it slower.  Additionally it has to wait for the OS to respond.
I gave you the example of different path names.  If you wanna open a file right away you have to use a path which is OS specific.
(If you're talking to me please use my name :) )
Any more questions?  I can explain further :)
i just don't understand the application installation process in ubtuntu
It puts certain files in certain places.  That's really all there is to it.  binaries usually go into /usr/bin/
Does that second router have a public access?
It must have a different IP address than 192.168.1.1  right?
it's worth a shot.  I'm not really sure it will work.
